definition: marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
lit. the gate of a noble house is like the sea/there is a wide gap between the nobility and the common people (idiom)
family of a functionary (i.e. educated middle class in Qing times)
rich and powerful/rich and influential person/big shot
family with a literary reputation (idiom); literary family
family of officials/family with connections to the bureaucracy (i.e. the middle classes in imperial China)
